txt.en: You must try to escape!\n\nRun north...into the strange trees.
Instance: Let's Take the Hornburg!
Your place in line is back a ways, near some other Orcs.\n\nYou should watch and wait.
Try to escape south
You must try to escape!\n\nRun north-west, towards the Fords of Isen.
Try to survive!
Watch and wait
Your place in line is back a ways, near some other Orcs.\n\nYou should get back in line.
You must try to escape!\n\nRun east, along the dike.
Run north!
Try to escape towards the north-west
Escape through the forest!
Try to escape towards the east
You must seize the Hornburg and drive out the Men!

'The night is almost over, but we'll take 'em. These horsemen have no friends to save them.

'We'll get over the walls and eat the hearts of every last one of them. Today we feast.

'Now get back in line, worm!'
Find a resting spot at the edge of the trees.
A blasted Elf has blocked the way
But where did these trees come from? This forest was not here before...was it?
Find a spot to rest, and rest briefly at the edge of the trees

'What do you think you're getting out of line for? It's not our turn yet. It'll never be our turn.

'The boys in front will do all the killing, and our swords don't even have a drop of blood.

'This ain't what I came for!'
Ask the boss when the battle will be done
Something has unnerved the other Orcs....
'Let me at 'em! What do you say, you brute? Let's charge!\n\n'Wait. What's...what's that?'
Your place in line is back a ways, near some other Orcs.\n\nYou should watch and wait.
This way is not safe!
Your place in line is back a ways, near some other Orcs.\n\nYou should speak with your neighbour.
Get back in line and talk to your neighbour
Look out!
Watch and wait
You must try to escape!\n\nRun south, towards Helm's Deep.
This way has been taken by the cursed Men!
Now you must flee! These strange trees will provide cover.
Talk to your neighbour again
Watch and wait
The boss wants you to get back in line
The Uruk-commander stands near the ugly gate up ahead.\n\nYou should ask the boss when the battle will be over, for you grow bored without a drop of blood to stain your sword.
